## Plottet risks and visuals

```{r}
#| label: risk-matrix
#| fig-cap: "Probability–Impact Matrix for project risks."
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 6

library(ggplot2)
library(ggrepel)
library(dplyr)
library(tibble)

# ------------------------------------------------------------------
# 1. Define the risks (ID + name + probability + impact)
# ------------------------------------------------------------------

risks <- tribble(
  ~RiskID, ~RiskName, ~Probability, ~Impact,
  "1", "Delayed data-sharing agreement", "Medium", "Medium",
  "2", "Participant withdrawal", "Low", "Medium",
  "3", "Additional trial site", "Low", "Medium",
  "4", "Delay in integrating data", "Medium", "Medium",
  "5", "Insufficient data type", "High", "High",
  "6", "Limited preparation", "Medium", "Medium"
)

# ------------------------------------------------------------------
# 2. Convert Probability & Impact to numeric positions (Low–Medium–High)
# ------------------------------------------------------------------

level_map <- c("Low" = 1, "Medium" = 2, "High" = 3)

risks <- risks %>%
  mutate(
    Prob_num = level_map[Probability],
    Impact_num = level_map[Impact]
  )

# Add jitter so labels do not overlap
set.seed(42)
risks <- risks %>%
  mutate(
    Prob_jit = Prob_num + runif(n(), -0.1, 0.1),
    Impact_jit = Impact_num + runif(n(), -0.1, 0.1)
  )

# ------------------------------------------------------------------
# 3. Background colors for the 3×3 grid (same structure as your matrix)
# ------------------------------------------------------------------

bg_colors <- data.frame(
  xmin = rep(c(0.5, 1.5, 2.5), each = 3),
  xmax = rep(c(1.5, 2.5, 3.5), each = 3),
  ymin = rep(c(0.5, 1.5, 2.5), times = 3),
  ymax = rep(c(1.5, 2.5, 3.5), times = 3),
  fill = rep(
    c("#f2f2f2", "#e8f5e9", "#dcedc8",
      "#fff9c4", "#ffe0b2", "#ffccbc",
      "#f2f2f2", "#e8f5e9", "#dcedc8"), 1
  )
)

# ------------------------------------------------------------------
# 4. Plot
# ------------------------------------------------------------------

ggplot() +
  geom_rect(
    data = bg_colors,
    aes(xmin = xmin, xmax = xmax, ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax, fill = fill),
    color = "grey80"
  ) +
  scale_fill_identity() +
  
  geom_point(
    data = risks,
    aes(x = Prob_jit, y = Impact_jit),
    size = 3,
    color = "#1b5e20"
  ) +
  
  geom_label_repel(
    data = risks,
    aes(x = Prob_jit, y = Impact_jit, label = paste0("Risk ", RiskID, ": ", RiskName)),
    size = 3.3,
    color = "black",
    fill = "white",
    box.padding = 0.3,
    label.size = 0.2,
    segment.color = "grey60",
    max.overlaps = Inf
  ) +
  
  scale_x_continuous(
    breaks = 1:3,
    labels = c("Low", "Medium", "High"),
    limits = c(0.5, 3.5)
  ) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    breaks = 1:3,
    labels = c("Low", "Medium", "High"),
    limits = c(0.5, 3.5)
  ) +
  
  labs(
    x = "Probability of occurrence",
    y = "Impact on project",
    title = "Risk Probability–Impact Matrix"
  ) +
  
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    panel.grid = element_blank(),
    legend.position = "none",
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 14)
  )
```

## Plottet risks and visuals for personal and relational risks

```{r}
#| label: risk-matrix-relationships
#| fig-cap: "Probability–Impact Matrix for personal and relational risks."
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 6

library(ggplot2)
library(ggrepel)
library(dplyr)
library(tibble)

# -------------------------------------------------------------
# 1. Define risks
# -------------------------------------------------------------

risks_rel <- tribble(
  ~RiskID, ~RiskName, ~Probability, ~Impact,
  "7", "Family–work imbalance", "High", "High",
  "8", "Australia stay challenges", "High", "Low",
  "9", "Changing project direction", "Medium", "Medium"
)

# -------------------------------------------------------------
# 2. Convert categorical levels to numeric scale
# -------------------------------------------------------------

level_map <- c("Low" = 1, "Medium" = 2, "High" = 3)

risks_rel <- risks_rel %>%
  mutate(
    Prob_num = level_map[Probability],
    Impact_num = level_map[Impact]
  )

# Add jitter to avoid label overlap
set.seed(1234)
risks_rel <- risks_rel %>%
  mutate(
    Prob_jit = Prob_num + runif(n(), -0.1, 0.1),
    Impact_jit = Impact_num + runif(n(), -0.1, 0.1)
  )

# -------------------------------------------------------------
# 3. Background color grid (same as previous matrices)
# -------------------------------------------------------------

bg_colors <- data.frame(
  xmin = rep(c(0.5, 1.5, 2.5), each = 3),
  xmax = rep(c(1.5, 2.5, 3.5), each = 3),
  ymin = rep(c(0.5, 1.5, 2.5), times = 3),
  ymax = rep(c(1.5, 2.5, 3.5), times = 3),

  )
)

# -------------------------------------------------------------
# 4. Plot

ggplot() +

    aes(xmin = xmin, xmax = xmax, ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax, fill = fill),
    color = "grey80"
  ) +
  scale_fill_identity() +
  
  geom_point(
    data = risks_rel,
    aes(x = Prob_jit, y = Impact_jit),

  ) +
```
